knowledge: Influenza Influenza  The onset of symptoms is sudden, and initial symptoms are predominately non-specific, including fever, chills, headaches, muscle pain or aching, a feeling of discomfort, loss of appetite, lack of energy/fatigue, and confusion.  These symptoms are usually accompanied by respiratory symptoms such as a dry cough, sore or dry throat, hoarse voice, and a stuffy or runny nose.  Coughing is the most common symptom.  Gastrointestinal symptoms may also occur, including nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and gastroenteritis, especially in children.  The standard influenza symptoms typically last for 2 - 8 days.   A 2021 study suggests influenza can cause long lasting symptoms in a similar way to long COVID. knowledge: Influenza Influenza  Annual vaccination can help to provide protection against influenza.  Influenza viruses, particularly IAV, evolve quickly, so flu vaccines are updated regularly to match which influenza strains are in circulation.  Vaccines provide protection against IAV subtypes H1N1 and H3N2 and one or two IBV subtypes. Vaccines provide protection against IAV subtypes H1N1 and H3N2 and one or two IBV subtypes.  Influenza infection is diagnosed with laboratory methods such as  antibody or antigen tests and a polymerase chain reaction  to identify viral nucleic acid.  The disease can be treated with supportive measures and, in severe cases, with antiviral drugs such as oseltamivir.  In healthy individuals, influenza is typically self-limiting and rarely fatal, but it can be deadly in high-risk groups. In a typical year, 5–15% of the population contracts influenza Influenza Influenza
response: Most people start feeling better after 3-7 days, but some may take up to 2 weeks to fully recover.

dialog: Hi Medi, I have some questions about influenza.
Sure, what do you want to know about it?
What causes influenza?
Influenza is caused by a virus that infects the respiratory tract. It's highly contagious.
How does influenza spread?
It spreads through respiratory droplets when an infected person coughs, sneezes or talks. You can also get it by touching a surface contaminated with the virus and then touching your mouth or nose.
Can influenza be deadly?
Yes, it can be deadly in high-risk groups like the elderly, young children, pregnant women, and people with weakened immune systems.
What can I do to prevent getting influenza?

dialog: Hello Medi, I recently had influenza and I want to know how to prevent getting it again?
The best way to prevent getting influenza again is to get vaccinated annually.
What if I already had the vaccine?
The vaccine is not 100% effective but it can still reduce the severity of symptoms and prevent hospitalization. You should also practice good hygiene like washing your hands frequently.
What about antiviral medications?
Antiviral medications like oseltamivir can be used to treat influenza but they work best when started within 48 hours of symptom onset.
What can I do to boost my immune system?
You can boost your immune system by eating a healthy diet, getting regular exercise, and managing your stress levels.
Thanks for your advice, Medi. Is there anything else I should know?

I have a high fever, chills, and body aches.
Based on your symptoms, it's possible that you do have the flu.
What should I do next?
You should rest, drink plenty of fluids, and take over-the-counter pain relievers.
Do I need to see a doctor?
If your symptoms get worse or don't improve after a few days, it's best to see a doctor.
Okay, thank you for the advice.

dialog: Hi Medi, can you explain how the flu vaccine works?
Of course. The flu vaccine stimulates your body to produce antibodies against the flu virus.
How effective is the vaccine?
The effectiveness varies from year to year depending on how well the vaccine matches the circulating strains of the virus.
Is it safe to get the vaccine?
Yes, it's safe. The vaccine is thoroughly tested before it's made available to the public.
Are there any side effects?
Some people may experience mild side effects, such as soreness or redness at the injection site. In rare cases, more serious side effects can occur.
I see. Thank you for the information.

dialog: Hi Medi, I just recovered from the flu. What should I do to prevent getting sick again?
Congratulations on your recovery. To prevent getting sick again, make sure to wash your hands frequently and avoid close contact with sick people.
Are there any other things I can do to boost my immune system?
Eating a healthy diet, getting enough sleep, and exercising regularly can all help boost your immune system.
What about getting the flu vaccine?
Yes, getting the flu vaccine is one of the most effective ways to prevent getting sick.
How often should I get the vaccine?
You should get the flu vaccine every year, as the strains of the virus can change from year to year.
I see. Thank you for the advice.
